stories.title: NYPD's 'Shrek Bus' Is Fake, Not a Bus, and Should Be Avoided at All Costs

stories.text:
I've been getting weird link behaviour on axios.com today, and was wondering whether anyone else has had the same thing.

So, clicking on what is (at the moment) the top "latest news" item on the front page - Scoop: Trump to sue Mark Zuckerberg, Jack Dorsey - actually yields an article from yesterday: At least a third of GOP midterm candidates have pushed Trump's election lie.

In this case, the "Trump to sue" article can be reached by clicking on North America had its hottest June on record, with the url [1]

This behaviour has been happening (for me) on every front-page item for the last hour or so.

[1] https://www.axios.com/north-america-hottest-june-record-45635cba-317b-40a1-9ce2-72e07e20bcb5.html
stories.title: Ask HN: Is anyone else experiencing odd link behaviour on axios.com?
